intro: Fimbristylis tamaensis, commonly known as the Tama sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils, often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The plant plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
